metadata.title: Middle School Math Glossary
metadata.description: Comprehensive math vocabulary with kid-friendly definitions

terms.definition: The distance a number is from zero on a number line, always shown as a positive number.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#1f2937" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="50" y1="95" x2="50" y2="105" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="100" y1="90" x2="100" y2="110" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="150" y1="95" x2="150" y2="105" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="42" y="125" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">-5</text>
  <text x="96" y="125" font-size="14" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">0</text>
  <text x="148" y="125" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">5</text>
  <line x1="50" y1="70" x2="100" y2="70" stroke="#3b82f6" stroke-width="3" marker-end="url(#bluearrow)" />
  <line x1="100" y1="70" x2="150" y2="70" stroke="#3b82f6" stroke-width="3" marker-end="url(#bluearrow)" />
  <defs>
    <marker id="bluearrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#3b82f6" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <text x="55" y="50" font-size="12" fill="#3b82f6">Distance: 5</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: An angle that measures less than 90 degrees, like the corner of a slice of pizza.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#2563eb" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="50" y1="150" x2="150" y2="150" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="50" y1="150" x2="130" y2="70" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <path d="M 70 150 A 20 20 0 0 1 58 136" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="85" y="140" font-size="16" fill="#f59e0b" font-weight="bold">45°</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The number zero, because adding zero to any number doesn't change it.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Additive Identity</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A number that when added to the original number equals zero, like 5 and -5.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Additive Inverse</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Two angles that share a common side and vertex but don't overlap.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="50" y1="120" x2="150" y2="120" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="50" y1="120" x2="100" y2="50" stroke="#10b981" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="50" y1="120" x2="120" y2="70" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="3" />
  <path d="M 70 120 A 20 20 0 0 1 61 105" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" />
  <path d="M 75 115 A 25 25 0 0 1 65 98" fill="#fbbf24" fill-opacity="0.3" />
  <text x="60" y="180" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Share a side</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A math phrase with numbers, variables, and operation signs, like 3x + 7.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="40" y="90" font-size="32" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">3x + 5</text>
  <text x="35" y="130" font-size="12" fill="#3b82f6">No = sign</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Angles on opposite sides of a transversal line between two parallel lines that are equal.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Alternate</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Interior</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Angles</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The amount of space inside a two-dimensional shape, measured in square units.
examples: The area of a 3×4 rectangle is 12 square units
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="40" y="50" width="120" height="80" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="50" y1="60" x2="150" y2="60" stroke="#cbd5e1" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="50" y1="75" x2="150" y2="75" stroke="#cbd5e1" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="50" y1="90" x2="150" y2="90" stroke="#cbd5e1" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="50" y1="105" x2="150" y2="105" stroke="#cbd5e1" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="50" y1="120" x2="150" y2="120" stroke="#cbd5e1" stroke-width="1" />
  <text x="55" y="160" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">Space inside</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A relationship between two sets of data that shows they tend to change together.
examples: height and shoe size often have positive association
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Association</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: You can group numbers differently when adding or multiplying and get the same answer.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Associative Property</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The flat face of a 3D shape that it rests on, like the bottom of a box.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Base</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">A</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The bottom side of a shape, or the side it sits on.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Base</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">A</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The number that gets multiplied by itself in an exponent expression, like the 2 in 2³.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Base</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">An</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A point that marks where a solution region begins or ends on a number line or graph.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Boundary Point</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A graph that shows data divided into four equal parts using a box and whiskers.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="30" y1="100" x2="170" y2="100" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="1" />
  <!-- Whiskers -->
  <line x1="40" y1="85" x2="40" y2="115" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="160" y1="85" x2="160" y2="115" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="40" y1="100" x2="70" y2="100" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="130" y1="100" x2="160" y2="100" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <!-- Box -->
  <rect x="70" y="80" width="60" height="40" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="100" y1="80" x2="100" y2="120" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="55" y="145" font-size="11" fill="#1f2937">Shows data spread</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Data that can be grouped into categories like colors, names, or types rather than numbers.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Categorical Variable</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: An angle whose vertex is at the center of a circle.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Central Angle</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A round graph divided into slices that show parts of a whole, also called a pie chart.
The distance around the outside of a circle, like the perimeter but for circles.
examples: A circle with radius 5 has circumference about 31.4
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="60" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="4" stroke-dasharray="8,4" />
  <path d="M 160 100 A 60 60 0 0 1 100 160" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="4" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#f59e0b" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <text x="60" y="50" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">distance</text>
  <text x="65" y="65" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">around</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A group of data points that are close together on a graph or in a data set.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Cluster</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Choosing groups randomly and then studying everyone in those groups, like surveying two whole classrooms.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Cluster Sample</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The number that multiplies a variable in algebra, like the 4 in 4x.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="60" y="100" font-size="48" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">4</text>
  <text x="95" y="100" font-size="48" fill="#3b82f6" font-weight="bold">x</text>
  <line x1="55" y1="110" x2="85" y2="110" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="40" y="140" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444">coefficient</text>
  <text x="40" y="160" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">(multiplies variable)</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Adding or subtracting terms that have the same variable, like turning 3x + 5x into 8x.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Combining</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Like</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Terms</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: You can switch the order of numbers when adding or multiplying and get the same answer.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Commutative Property</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: You can multiply numbers in any order and get the same result.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Commutative</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Property</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: All the outcomes in a sample space that are NOT in your event.
examples: If event is rolling even, complement is rolling odd
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Complement</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Two angles that add up to exactly 90 degrees.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="50" y1="120" x2="120" y2="120" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="50" y1="120" x2="50" y2="50" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="50" y1="120" x2="95" y2="75" stroke="#10b981" stroke-width="3" />
  <path d="M 70 120 A 20 20 0 0 1 50 100" fill="#fbbf24" fill-opacity="0.3" />
  <path d="M 62 108 A 20 20 0 0 1 50 90" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" />
  <text x="130" y="100" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">30° + 60°</text>
  <text x="140" y="120" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">= 90°</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Two or more events happening together, like flipping a coin and rolling a die.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="70" cy="100" r="40" fill="#fbbf24" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="57" y="112" font-size="24" fill="#92400e" font-weight="bold">H</text>
  <circle cx="130" cy="100" r="40" fill="#fbbf24" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="119" y="112" font-size="24" fill="#92400e" font-weight="bold">T</text>
  <text x="50" y="170" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">Heads or Tails</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Interest earned on both the original amount of money and the interest already earned.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Compound Interest</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A 3D shape with a circular base that comes to a point at the top, like an ice cream cone.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <ellipse cx="100" cy="160" rx="60" ry="15" fill="#60a5fa" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <path d="M 40 160 L 100 40 L 160 160" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="40" r="3" fill="#ef4444" />

</svg>

terms.definition: Lines or paths that come together and meet at a point.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Confluent</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: An educated guess about a math pattern that you think is true but haven't proven yet.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Conjecture</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Whole numbers that follow each other in order, like 5, 6, and 7.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Consecutive Integers</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The constant number you multiply by in a proportional relationship, shown as k in y = kx.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Constant</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Proportionality</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A number in an expression that stands alone without a variable, like the 5 in 2x + 5.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="30" y="90" font-size="28" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">2x +</text>
  <text x="105" y="90" font-size="28" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">7</text>
  <line x1="105" y1="95" x2="130" y2="95" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="80" y="130" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444">constant</text>
  <text x="65" y="150" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">(no variable)</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Drawing a geometric figure precisely using only a compass and straightedge.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Construction</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A graph made of a connected line or curve with no breaks or gaps.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Continuous Graph</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Choosing people for a survey based on who is easiest to reach, which may be biased.
examples: surveying only people at the mall
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Convenience Sample</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Angles in the same position when a line crosses two parallel lines, and they're equal.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Corresponding Angles</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Matching sides and angles in congruent or similar figures.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Corresponding Parts</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: An example that proves a statement or conjecture is false.
examples: To disprove 'all numbers are positive,' use -3
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Counterexample</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The shape you see when you slice through a 3D object, like cutting through an orange.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Cross Section</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Multiplying a number by itself three times, like 2³ = 2 × 2 × 2 = 8.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="40" y="70" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">2</text>
  <text x="75" y="55" font-size="24" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">3</text>
  <text x="110" y="70" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">=8</text>
  <text x="40" y="120" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">2 × 2 × 2 = 8</text>
  <!-- Small cube visual -->
  <rect x="45" y="140" width="30" height="30" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="45,140 55,130 85,130 75,140" fill="#60a5fa" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="75,140 85,130 85,160 75,170" fill="#93c5fd" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />

</svg>

terms.definition: The number that when multiplied by itself three times gives you the original number.
examples: The cube root of 27 is 3 because 3³ = 27
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="30" y="80" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">√</text>
  <line x1="50" y1="45" x2="85" y2="45" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="55" y="75" font-size="32" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">25</text>
  <text x="100" y="80" font-size="40" fill="#10b981" font-weight="bold">=5</text>
  <text x="30" y="130" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">5 × 5 = 25</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A 3D shape with two circular bases connected by a curved side, like a soup can.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <ellipse cx="100" cy="60" rx="50" ry="15" fill="#60a5fa" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="50" y="60" width="100" height="90" fill="#3b82f6" stroke="none" />
  <line x1="50" y1="60" x2="50" y2="150" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="150" y1="60" x2="150" y2="150" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <ellipse cx="100" cy="150" rx="50" ry="15" fill="#93c5fd" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />

</svg>

terms.definition: A unit for measuring angles, where a full circle is 360 degrees.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Degree</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Events where the outcome of one affects the probability of the other happening.
examples: drawing two cards without replacing the first
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Dependent Events</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The variable that changes based on another variable, usually shown on the y-axis.
examples: In y = 2x, y is the dependent variable
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Dependent Variable</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The specific results you're looking for when calculating probability.
examples: rolling a 5 or 6 on a die
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Desired Outcomes</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A line segment that goes straight across a circle through its center.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="60" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="40" y1="100" x2="160" y2="100" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="3" />
  <circle cx="40" cy="100" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="160" cy="100" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <text x="75" y="90" font-size="14" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">diameter</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Making a shape larger or smaller while keeping the same shape, like zooming in or out.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="3" fill="#ef4444" />
  <polygon points="70,70 130,70 130,130 70,130" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="50,50 150,50 150,150 50,150" fill="none" stroke="#10b981" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,3" />
  <text x="60" y="180" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Enlarge/shrink</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A graph made of separate, individual points that are not connected.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Discrete Graph</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Multiplying a number by a sum is the same as multiplying each addend separately.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Distributive Property</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A line segment where two faces of a 3D shape meet.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Edge</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A math sentence that shows two expressions are equal using an equals sign.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="25" y="90" font-size="28" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">2x + 3 = 11</text>
  <rect x="80" y="65" width="20" height="30" fill="none" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="75" y="135" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444">Equal sign!</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A tool with two sides for solving equations by keeping both sides balanced.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Equation Mat</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Solving a system of equations by setting two expressions equal to each other.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Equal</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Values</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Method</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Having the same value, even if they look different.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Equivalent</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Algebraic expressions that have the same value for all values of the variables.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Equivalent Expressions</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Fractions that represent the same amount but have different numerators and denominators.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="20" y="40" width="60" height="30" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="20" y="40" width="30" height="30" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.6" />
  <line x1="50" y1="40" x2="50" y2="70" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="30" y="95" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">1/2</text>
  
  <text x="90" y="60" font-size="18" fill="#10b981" font-weight="bold">=</text>
  
  <rect x="120" y="40" width="60" height="30" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="120" y="40" width="30" height="30" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.6" />
  <line x1="135" y1="40" x2="135" y2="70" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="150" y1="40" x2="150" y2="70" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="165" y1="40" x2="165" y2="70" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="130" y="95" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">2/4</text>
  <text x="45" y="130" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Same amount!</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Ratios that express the same relationship between quantities.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="50" cy="70" r="20" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="110" cy="70" r="20" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="50" cy="130" r="20" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="110" cy="130" r="20" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="170" cy="130" r="20" fill="#ef4444" />
  <text x="50" y="180" font-size="18" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">2 : 3</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Finding the value of an expression by substituting numbers for variables and calculating.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Evaluate</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The probability found by doing an experiment and recording what actually happens.
examples: flipping a coin 100 times and recording results
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Experimental Probability</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A small number that tells how many times to multiply the base by itself.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="40" y="80" font-size="48" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">5</text>
  <text x="80" y="60" font-size="28" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">3</text>
  <text x="35" y="130" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">= 5 × 5 × 5</text>
  <text x="55" y="155" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">= 125</text>
  <rect x="75" y="40" width="35" height="35" fill="none" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" rx="3" />
  <text x="115" y="57" font-size="11" fill="#ef4444">exponent</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: When a quantity increases by multiplying by the same factor repeatedly, growing very quickly.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Exponential Growth</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A math phrase with numbers, variables, and operations but no equals sign.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="40" y="90" font-size="32" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">3x + 5</text>
  <text x="35" y="130" font-size="12" fill="#3b82f6">No = sign</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A tool for comparing two algebraic expressions side by side.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Expression</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Comparison</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Mat</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: An angle formed outside a triangle when you extend one of its sides.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Exterior</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Angle</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A flat surface on a 3D shape.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Face</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Breaking down a number or expression into parts that multiply together to make it.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Factor</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">To</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Factor</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The process of writing a number or expression as a product of its factors.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Factoring</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The value that is greater than 25% of the data and less than 75% of the data.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">First Quartile</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A coordinate plane divided into four sections by horizontal and vertical axes.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#1f2937" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="100" y1="180" x2="100" y2="20" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <text x="170" y="120" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">x</text>
  <text x="110" y="30" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">y</text>
  <circle cx="140" cy="60" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <text x="145" y="65" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444">(x,y)</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A technique for eliminating fractions from an equation by multiplying everything by a common denominator.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Fraction</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Buster</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Method</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Multiplying both sides of an equation by the same number to clear fractions.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Fraction Busters</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A fraction where the numerator is larger than the denominator, also called an improper fraction.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Fraction</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Greater</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Than</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A table that shows how many times each value or category appears in a data set.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="40" y1="160" x2="160" y2="160" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="40" y1="40" x2="40" y2="160" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="55" y="100" width="20" height="60" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <rect x="85" y="70" width="20" height="90" fill="#10b981" />
  <rect x="115" y="90" width="20" height="70" fill="#f59e0b" />
  <text x="50" y="20" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">Bar Graph</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A rule that assigns exactly one output value for each input value.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Function</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A fraction equal to one that you multiply by to create equivalent fractions or ratios.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Giant One</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A visual way to show data or relationships using points, lines, or bars.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="40" y1="160" x2="160" y2="160" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="40" y1="40" x2="40" y2="160" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="55" y="100" width="20" height="60" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <rect x="85" y="70" width="20" height="90" fill="#10b981" />
  <rect x="115" y="90" width="20" height="70" fill="#f59e0b" />
  <text x="50" y="20" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">Bar Graph</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: How much something increases in size or value over time.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Growth</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A right triangle used to find the slope of a line by showing vertical and horizontal change.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Growth Triangle</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The perpendicular distance from the base to the top of a shape.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Height</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A bar graph that shows how often data values fall within specific ranges or intervals.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="30" y1="160" x2="170" y2="160" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="30" y1="40" x2="30" y2="160" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="30" y="110" width="28" height="50" fill="#3b82f6" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" />
  <rect x="58" y="80" width="28" height="80" fill="#3b82f6" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" />
  <rect x="86" y="100" width="28" height="60" fill="#3b82f6" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" />
  <rect x="114" y="120" width="28" height="40" fill="#3b82f6" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" />
  <rect x="142" y="130" width="28" height="30" fill="#3b82f6" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" />
  <text x="55" y="185" font-size="11" fill="#1f2937">Data in ranges</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The longest side of a right triangle, located across from the right angle.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="50,150 50,70 140,150" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <rect x="50" y="135" width="15" height="15" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="35" y="115" font-size="12" fill="#10b981" font-weight="bold">leg</text>
  <text x="85" y="175" font-size="12" fill="#10b981" font-weight="bold">leg</text>
  <text x="95" y="100" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">hypotenuse</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Events where one happening doesn't change the probability of the other happening.
examples: flipping a coin and rolling a die
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Independent Events</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The variable you can control or change, usually shown on the x-axis.
examples: In y = 2x, x is the independent variable
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Independent Variable</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A conclusion about a whole population based on data from a sample.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Inference</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A math sentence that compares two expressions using symbols like <, >, ≤, or ≥.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="40" y="80" font-size="36" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">x > 5</text>
  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#3b82f6" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="30" y1="130" x2="170" y2="130" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="100" y1="125" x2="100" y2="135" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="130" r="5" fill="white" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="105" y1="130" x2="165" y2="130" stroke="#3b82f6" stroke-width="4" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <text x="95" y="155" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">5</text>
  <text x="40" y="180" font-size="11" fill="#1f2937">Greater than 5</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The symbols used to compare values: < (less than), > (greater than), ≤, and ≥.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Inequality Symbols</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: All positive and negative whole numbers, including zero.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#1f2937" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="30" y1="95" x2="30" y2="105" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="60" y1="95" x2="60" y2="105" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="90" y1="95" x2="90" y2="105" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="120" y1="95" x2="120" y2="105" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="150" y1="95" x2="150" y2="105" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="23" y="125" font-size="14" fill="#ef4444">-2</text>
  <text x="53" y="125" font-size="14" fill="#ef4444">-1</text>
  <text x="87" y="125" font-size="14" fill="#10b981">0</text>
  <text x="118" y="125" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">1</text>
  <text x="148" y="125" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">2</text>
  <text x="40" y="150" font-size="11" fill="#1f2937">Whole numbers (+ and -)</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Extra money you earn when saving or pay when borrowing, usually a percentage of the amount.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Interest</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A range of values between two numbers, often used in graphs and data organization.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Interval</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The difference between the third quartile and first quartile, showing the spread of the middle data.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Interquartile</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Range</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Iqr</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Numbers that cannot be written as a simple fraction and have decimals that never end or repeat.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Irrational Numbers</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A side face of a 3D shape that is not the base.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Lateral Face</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: All the side faces of a 3D shape except for the base(s).
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Lateral Faces</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Points on a graph where grid lines cross and both coordinates are whole numbers.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Lattice Points</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The two shorter sides of a right triangle that form the right angle.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="50,150 50,70 140,150" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <rect x="50" y="135" width="15" height="15" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="35" y="115" font-size="12" fill="#10b981" font-weight="bold">leg</text>
  <text x="85" y="175" font-size="12" fill="#10b981" font-weight="bold">leg</text>
  <text x="95" y="100" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">hypotenuse</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A straight line drawn through data points that best represents the trend or pattern.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#9ca3af" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="30" y1="170" x2="170" y2="170" stroke="#9ca3af" stroke-width="1" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="30" y1="170" x2="30" y2="30" stroke="#9ca3af" stroke-width="1" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <circle cx="50" cy="150" r="4" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="70" cy="135" r="4" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="90" cy="120" r="4" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="110" cy="100" r="4" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="130" cy="80" r="4" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="150" cy="65" r="4" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <text x="45" y="20" font-size="11" fill="#1f2937">Points show</text>
  <text x="45" y="33" font-size="11" fill="#1f2937">relationships</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: An equation whose graph is a straight line, usually in the form y = mx + b.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#9ca3af" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#d1d5db" stroke-width="1" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="100" y1="180" x2="100" y2="20" stroke="#d1d5db" stroke-width="1" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="30" y1="150" x2="170" y2="50" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="40" y="35" font-size="16" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">y = mx + b</text>
  <text x="50" y="185" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">straight line</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: When something increases by adding the same amount each time, creating a straight line graph.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Linear Growth</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Whether an equation or pattern creates a straight line (linear) or a curve (non-linear) when graphed.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Linear</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Non-Linear</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Form</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The smallest number that all denominators in a problem divide into evenly.
examples: For ½ and â…“, the LCD is 6
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Lowest</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Common</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Denominator</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The average of a set of numbers found by adding them all up and dividing by how many there are.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="20" y="40" font-size="16" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">Data: 2, 3, 3, 5, 7</text>
  <text x="30" y="80" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">Mean = 4</text>
  <text x="100" y="80" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(average)</text>
  <text x="30" y="110" font-size="14" fill="#10b981">Median = 3</text>
  <text x="110" y="110" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(middle)</text>
  <text x="30" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#f59e0b">Mode = 3</text>
  <text x="100" y="140" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(most)</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: To find the size, length, or amount of something using units.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="30" y="85" width="140" height="30" fill="#fef3c7" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="40" y1="85" x2="40" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="60" y1="85" x2="60" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="80" y1="85" x2="80" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="100" y1="85" x2="100" y2="100" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="120" y1="85" x2="120" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="140" y1="85" x2="140" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="160" y1="85" x2="160" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <text x="95" y="108" font-size="10" fill="#92400e">5</text>
  <text x="60" y="140" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Find size/length</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A number with a unit that tells the size, length, weight, or amount of something.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="30" y="85" width="140" height="30" fill="#fef3c7" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="40" y1="85" x2="40" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="60" y1="85" x2="60" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="80" y1="85" x2="80" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="100" y1="85" x2="100" y2="100" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="120" y1="85" x2="120" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="140" y1="85" x2="140" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="160" y1="85" x2="160" y2="95" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <text x="95" y="108" font-size="10" fill="#92400e">5</text>
  <text x="60" y="140" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Find size/length</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A single number that represents the center or typical value of a data set.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="20" y="40" font-size="16" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">Data: 2, 3, 3, 5, 7</text>
  <text x="30" y="80" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">Mean = 4</text>
  <text x="100" y="80" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(average)</text>
  <text x="30" y="110" font-size="14" fill="#10b981">Median = 3</text>
  <text x="110" y="110" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(middle)</text>
  <text x="30" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#f59e0b">Mode = 3</text>
  <text x="100" y="140" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(most)</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The middle number when a set of data is arranged in order from smallest to largest.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="20" y="40" font-size="16" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">Data: 2, 3, 3, 5, 7</text>
  <text x="30" y="80" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">Mean = 4</text>
  <text x="100" y="80" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(average)</text>
  <text x="30" y="110" font-size="14" fill="#10b981">Median = 3</text>
  <text x="110" y="110" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(middle)</text>
  <text x="30" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#f59e0b">Mode = 3</text>
  <text x="100" y="140" font-size="11" fill="#6b7280">(most)</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A number written as a whole number and a fraction together, like 2 ½.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Mixed Number</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The number one, because multiplying any number by one doesn't change it.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Multiplicative Identity</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Two numbers that multiply together to equal one, also called reciprocals.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Multiplicative Inverse</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Events that cannot happen at the same time.
examples: rolling an odd number and even number on one die
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Mutually Exclusive</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: When one variable increases and the other tends to decrease in a data set.
examples: hours of TV watched and test scores
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Negative Association</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Numbers or quantities that don't share a common unit of measurement.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Non-Commensurate</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A term in an expression that is just a number without a variable.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Numerical Term</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: An angle that measures more than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#2563eb" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="50" y1="150" x2="150" y2="150" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="50" y1="150" x2="70" y2="60" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <path d="M 70 150 A 30 30 0 0 1 51 125" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="75" y="125" font-size="16" fill="#f59e0b" font-weight="bold">120°</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The rules for which calculations to do first: parentheses, exponents, multiply/divide, add/subtract (PEMDAS).
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Order</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Operations</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A possible result of a probability experiment.
examples: heads or tails when flipping a coin
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="50" y="50" width="100" height="100" rx="10" fill="white" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="3" />
  <circle cx="75" cy="75" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />
  <circle cx="125" cy="125" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />
  <circle cx="125" cy="75" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />
  <circle cx="75" cy="125" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />

</svg>

terms.definition: A data point that is much higher or lower than most of the other data.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="40" cy="100" r="5" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="70" cy="100" r="5" fill="#3b82f6" />

  <text x="40" y="140" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Far from others</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Data values that are unusually far away from the rest of the data in a set.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="40" cy="100" r="5" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="70" cy="100" r="5" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="90" cy="100" r="5" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="105" cy="100" r="5" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="118" cy="100" r="5" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <circle cx="170" cy="100" r="8" fill="#ef4444" />
  <line x1="165" y1="95" x2="175" y2="105" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="165" y1="105" x2="175" y2="95" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="40" y="140" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Far from others</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A U-shaped curve that is the graph of a quadratic equation.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#9ca3af" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#d1d5db" stroke-width="1" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="100" y1="180" x2="100" y2="20" stroke="#d1d5db" stroke-width="1" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <path d="M 30 180 Q 100 60 170 180" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="60" y="40" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">U-shaped</text>
  <text x="75" y="58" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">curve</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Lines that never intersect and stay the same distance apart forever, like train tracks.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="30" y1="70" x2="170" y2="70" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="30" y1="130" x2="170" y2="130" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="35" y1="73" x2="41" y2="73" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="35" y1="80" x2="41" y2="80" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="35" y1="133" x2="41" y2="133" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="35" y1="140" x2="41" y2="140" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="55" y="105" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Never meet</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A four-sided shape where opposite sides are parallel and equal in length.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="60,60 160,60 140,140 40,140" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />

terms.definition: A number that describes a characteristic of an entire population.

terms.definition: Dividing something into separate parts or sections.

</svg>
