terms.definition: The amount something increases or decreases expressed as a percentage of the original amount.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Percent Change</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A number that is the result of multiplying a whole number by itself three times.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="40" y="70" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">2</text>
  <text x="75" y="55" font-size="24" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">3</text>
  <text x="110" y="70" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">=8</text>
  <text x="40" y="120" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">2 × 2 × 2 = 8</text>
  <!-- Small cube visual -->
  <rect x="45" y="140" width="30" height="30" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="45,140 55,130 85,130 75,140" fill="#60a5fa" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="75,140 85,130 85,160 75,170" fill="#93c5fd" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />

</svg>

terms.definition: A number that is the result of multiplying a whole number by itself.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="40" y="70" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">4</text>
  <text x="75" y="55" font-size="24" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">2</text>
  <text x="110" y="70" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">=16</text>
  <rect x="40" y="100" width="60" height="60" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="55" y1="100" x2="55" y2="160" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="70" y1="100" x2="70" y2="160" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="85" y1="100" x2="85" y2="160" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="40" y1="115" x2="100" y2="115" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="40" y1="130" x2="100" y2="130" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="40" y1="145" x2="100" y2="145" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <text x="110" y="135" font-size="12" fill="#2563eb">4×4 grid</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The total distance around the outside of a flat shape.
examples: A square with sides of 4 has perimeter 16
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="50" y="60" width="100" height="80" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="4" stroke-dasharray="8,4" />
  <text x="40" y="45" font-size="12" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold">→</text>
  <text x="145" y="60" font-size="12" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold">↓</text>
  <text x="145" y="145" font-size="12" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold">←</text>
  <text x="40" y="145" font-size="12" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold">↑</text>
  <text x="45" y="175" font-size="13" fill="#1f2937">Distance around</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Lines that meet at a right angle, forming a 90-degree corner.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="100" y1="30" x2="100" y2="170" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="30" y1="100" x2="170" y2="100" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <rect x="100" y="100" width="15" height="15" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" transform="translate(-7.5, -7.5)" />
  <text x="120" y="90" font-size="14" fill="#f59e0b" font-weight="bold">90°</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A special number (about 3.14) that represents the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Pi Ï€</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The exact point where two or more lines or curves cross each other.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Point</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Intersection</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A closed flat shape made up of straight line segments.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Polygon</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A 3D shape made up of flat polygon faces.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Polyhedron</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The entire group of people or things you want to study or learn about.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Population</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: When both variables in a data set tend to increase together.
examples: height and weight often increase together
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Positive Association</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: All the different results that could happen in a probability experiment.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="50" y="50" width="100" height="100" rx="10" fill="white" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="3" />
  <circle cx="75" cy="75" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />
  <circle cx="125" cy="125" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />
  <circle cx="125" cy="75" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />
  <circle cx="75" cy="125" r="8" fill="#1f2937" />

</svg>

terms.definition: A 3D shape with two identical parallel bases connected by rectangular faces.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="50,100 130,100 130,170 50,170" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="50,100 80,70 160,70 130,100" fill="#60a5fa" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="130,100 160,70 160,140 130,170" fill="#93c5fd" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />

</svg>

terms.definition: A number between 0 and 1 that tells how likely something is to happen.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Probability</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A chart that organizes and shows all possible outcomes and their probabilities.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Probability Table</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A branching diagram that shows all possible outcomes of multiple events.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="30" cy="100" r="8" fill="#3b82f6" />
  <line x1="35" y1="95" x2="70" y2="70" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="35" y1="105" x2="70" y2="130" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <circle cx="75" cy="70" r="6" fill="#10b981" />
  <circle cx="75" cy="130" r="6" fill="#ef4444" />
  <line x1="80" y1="68" x2="110" y2="55" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="80" y1="72" x2="110" y2="85" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="80" y1="128" x2="110" y2="115" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <line x1="80" y1="132" x2="110" y2="145" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1.5" />
  <circle cx="115" cy="55" r="4" fill="#10b981" />
  <circle cx="115" cy="85" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="115" cy="115" r="4" fill="#10b981" />
  <circle cx="115" cy="145" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <text x="45" y="185" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">All outcomes</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The original amount of money saved or borrowed before interest is added.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Principal</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A relationship where two quantities always have the same ratio, forming a straight line through the origin.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Proportional Relationship</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A tool shaped like a half circle used to measure or draw angles in degrees.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <path d="M 40 120 A 60 60 0 0 1 160 120 Z" fill="#dbeafe" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="100" y1="120" x2="100" y2="60" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="100" y1="120" x2="70" y2="80" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="100" y1="120" x2="130" y2="80" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="40" y1="120" x2="160" y2="120" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="50" y="155" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Measure angles</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: In a right triangle, the square of the hypotenuse equals the sum of squares of the other sides (a² + b² = c²).
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Pythagorean Theorem</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A 3D shape with a polygon base and triangular faces that meet at a point at the top.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="100,40 30,160 170,160" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="100" y1="40" x2="100" y2="160" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="30" y1="160" x2="170" y2="160" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="40" r="3" fill="#ef4444" />

</svg>

terms.definition: One of the values that divides a data set into four equal parts.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Quartile</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The answer you get when you divide one number by another.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Quotient</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The symbol âˆš used to show square roots or other roots of numbers.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Radical Sign</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The distance from the center of a circle to any point on its edge.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="60" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="100" y1="100" x2="160" y2="100" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="3" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="160" cy="100" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <text x="115" y="95" font-size="14" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">radius</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A sample where every member of the population has an equal chance of being chosen.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Random Sample</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A ratio that compares two different units, like miles per hour or dollars per pound.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Rate</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Numbers that can be written as a fraction of two whole numbers.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Rational Numbers</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A line that starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Ray</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Two numbers that multiply together to equal one, found by flipping a fraction.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Reciprocals</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A four-sided shape with four right angles and opposite sides that are equal and parallel.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="40" y="60" width="120" height="80" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <rect x="40" y="60" width="8" height="8" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="152" y="60" width="8" height="8" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="40" y="132" width="8" height="8" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="152" y="132" width="8" height="8" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />

</svg>

terms.definition: A 3D shape with six rectangular faces, like a box or shoebox.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="50,100 130,100 130,170 50,170" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="50,100 80,70 160,70 130,100" fill="#60a5fa" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="130,100 160,70 160,140 130,170" fill="#93c5fd" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />

</svg>

terms.definition: Simplifying a fraction to lowest terms by dividing the numerator and denominator by their greatest common factor.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Reduce</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Flipping a shape over a line to create a mirror image.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="100" y1="20" x2="100" y2="180" stroke="#9ca3af" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5" />
  <polygon points="50,60 70,100 30,100" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="150,60 130,100 170,100" fill="#ef4444" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#dc2626" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="55" y="50" font-size="12" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold">Original</text>
  <text x="125" y="50" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">Mirror</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: How two or more quantities or variables are connected or affect each other.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Relationship</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The two angles inside a triangle that are not next to a given exterior angle.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Remote</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Interior</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Angles</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A decimal where one or more digits repeat forever in a pattern.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="50" y="80" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">3.14</text>
  <line x1="85" y1="85" x2="85" y2="110" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="95" y="105" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">decimal point</text>
  <text x="35" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">3 ones</text>
  <text x="90" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">.1 tenths</text>
  <text x="110" y="160" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">.04 hundredths</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A sample that accurately reflects the characteristics of the whole population.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Representative Sample</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Moving a shape by sliding, flipping, or rotating without changing its size or shape.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Rigid Transformations</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: An angle that measures exactly 90 degrees, forming a perfect square corner.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="50" y1="150" x2="150" y2="150" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="50" y1="150" x2="50" y2="50" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <rect x="50" y="135" width="15" height="15" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="75" y="130" font-size="16" fill="#f59e0b" font-weight="bold">90°</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Turning a shape around a fixed point by a certain number of degrees.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="3" fill="#ef4444" />
  <polygon points="80,80 120,80 120,120" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="80,120 80,80 120,80" fill="#10b981" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#059669" stroke-width="2" />
  <path d="M 130 100 A 30 30 0 0 1 100 130" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#f59e0b" />
    </marker>
  </defs>

</svg>

terms.definition: A mathematical pattern or formula that describes how to find each term or output in a sequence.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Rule</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: All the possible outcomes of a probability experiment.
examples: heads and tails for a coin flip
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Sample Space</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The ratio between measurements on a drawing or model and the actual object.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Scale</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A drawing that represents a real object but is larger or smaller by a fixed ratio.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Scale Drawing</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The number you multiply by to enlarge or reduce a figure in a dilation.
examples: scale factor of 2 doubles the size
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Scale Factor</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A triangle where all three sides have different lengths.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="60,40 30,160 170,150" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="85" y="100" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">All sides</text>
  <text x="75" y="120" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">different</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Making something larger or smaller while keeping the same proportions.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Scaling</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Writing very large or small numbers as a number between 1 and 10 times a power of 10.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="20" y="70" font-size="20" fill="#1f2937">3,000,000</text>
  <line x1="30" y1="90" x2="150" y2="90" stroke="#10b981" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#downarrow)" />
  <defs>
    <marker id="downarrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="5" refY="9" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 0, 5 10" fill="#10b981" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <text x="40" y="130" font-size="24" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">3 × 10</text>
  <text x="115" y="115" font-size="16" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">6</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Shapes that have the same shape but may be different sizes, with proportional sides.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="40,120 60,80 80,120" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="110,140 140,60 170,140" fill="#10b981" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#059669" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="50" y="180" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Same shape,</text>
  <text x="45" y="195" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">different size</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Shapes with the same angles and proportional sides, one being a scaled version of the other.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="40,120 60,80 80,120" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="110,140 140,60 170,140" fill="#10b981" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#059669" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="50" y="180" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Same shape,</text>
  <text x="45" y="195" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">different size</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Making an expression or fraction easier to read by combining like terms or reducing.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Simplify</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Interest calculated only on the original amount of money, not on any interest earned.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Simple Interest</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Using a model or activity to imitate a real-life situation and study its probabilities.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Simulation</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: One action or happening in a probability experiment, like rolling a die once.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Single Event</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: How steep a line is, found by dividing the vertical change by the horizontal change.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#1f2937" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="20" y1="180" x2="180" y2="20" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="50" y1="165" x2="120" y2="165" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="120" y1="165" x2="120" y2="80" stroke="#10b981" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <text x="65" y="180" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444">run</text>
  <text x="130" y="130" font-size="12" fill="#10b981">rise</text>
  <text x="50" y="35" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">rise/run</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A value that makes an equation or inequality true when you substitute it in.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Solution</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A perfectly round 3D shape where every point on the surface is the same distance from the center.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <radialGradient id="sphereGrad">
      <stop offset="30%" stop-color="#60a5fa" />
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#2563eb" />
    </radialGradient>
  </defs>
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="65" fill="url(#sphereGrad)" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <ellipse cx="100" cy="100" rx="65" ry="20" fill="none" stroke="#1e40af" stroke-width="1.5" opacity="0.5" />

</svg>

terms.definition: Multiplying a number by itself, like 5² = 5 × 5 = 25.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="40" y="70" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">4</text>
  <text x="75" y="55" font-size="24" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">2</text>
  <text x="110" y="70" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">=16</text>
  <rect x="40" y="100" width="60" height="60" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="55" y1="100" x2="55" y2="160" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="70" y1="100" x2="70" y2="160" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="85" y1="100" x2="85" y2="160" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="40" y1="115" x2="100" y2="115" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="40" y1="130" x2="100" y2="130" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <line x1="40" y1="145" x2="100" y2="145" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="1" />
  <text x="110" y="135" font-size="12" fill="#2563eb">4×4 grid</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A number that when multiplied by itself gives you the original number.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="30" y="80" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">√</text>
  <line x1="50" y1="45" x2="85" y2="45" stroke="#1f2937" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="55" y="75" font-size="32" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">25</text>
  <text x="100" y="80" font-size="40" fill="#10b981" font-weight="bold">=5</text>
  <text x="30" y="130" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">5 × 5 = 25</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Writing a number in its regular way using digits, like 1,234 instead of words or other forms.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Standard Form</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A graph that organizes data by splitting each number into a stem and leaf part.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#9ca3af" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="30" y1="160" x2="170" y2="160" stroke="#9ca3af" stroke-width="1" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <line x1="30" y1="160" x2="30" y2="40" stroke="#9ca3af" stroke-width="1" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" />
  <polyline points="40,140 70,120 100,100 130,80 160,70" fill="none" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <circle cx="40" cy="140" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="70" cy="120" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="130" cy="80" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="160" cy="70" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <text x="50" y="25" font-size="11" fill="#1f2937">Change over time</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: An angle that measures exactly 180 degrees, forming a straight line.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="100" r="3" fill="#ef4444" />
  <path d="M 120 100 A 20 20 0 0 1 80 100" fill="none" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="85" y="85" font-size="16" fill="#f59e0b" font-weight="bold">180°</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: How closely two variables in a data set follow a pattern together.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Strength</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">An</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Replacing a variable with its value or another expression in an equation.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Substitution</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Two angles that add up to exactly 180 degrees.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="100" y1="100" x2="140" y2="50" stroke="#10b981" stroke-width="3" />
  <path d="M 120 100 A 20 20 0 0 1 108 86" fill="#fbbf24" fill-opacity="0.4" />
  <path d="M 80 100 A 20 20 0 0 1 92 86" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.4" />
  <text x="55" y="85" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">120°</text>
  <text x="120" y="85" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">60°</text>
  <text x="60" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">Add to 180°</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The total area of all the faces or outer surfaces of a 3D shape.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <!-- Unfolded cube net -->
  <rect x="70" y="30" width="30" height="30" fill="#dbeafe" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="40" y="60" width="30" height="30" fill="#bfdbfe" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="70" y="60" width="30" height="30" fill="#93c5fd" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="100" y="60" width="30" height="30" fill="#60a5fa" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="130" y="60" width="30" height="30" fill="#3b82f6" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <rect x="70" y="90" width="30" height="30" fill="#2563eb" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="40" y="145" font-size="11" fill="#1f2937">All outside faces</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: Two or more equations with the same variables that are solved together.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">System</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Of</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Equations</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: An organized list that shows all possible outcomes in a logical order.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Systematic List</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A single number, variable, or the product of numbers and variables in an expression.
examples: In 3x + 5, there are two terms: 3x and 5
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Term</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A decimal that ends after a certain number of digits and doesn't go on forever.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="50" y="80" font-size="40" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">3.14</text>
  <line x1="85" y1="85" x2="85" y2="110" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="95" y="105" font-size="12" fill="#ef4444" font-weight="bold">decimal point</text>
  <text x="35" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">3 ones</text>
  <text x="90" y="140" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">.1 tenths</text>
  <text x="110" y="160" font-size="14" fill="#3b82f6">.04 hundredths</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The expected probability calculated by dividing desired outcomes by total possible outcomes.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="24" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Theoretical Probability</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The value that is greater than 75% of the data and less than 25% of the data.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Third Quartile</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A repeating visual design using shapes, often used to explore algebraic patterns.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Tile Pattern</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Sliding a shape to a new position without rotating or flipping it.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="40,80 60,100 40,120" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="130,80 150,100 130,120" fill="#ef4444" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#dc2626" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="60" y1="100" x2="130" y2="100" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" stroke-dasharray="5,5" />
  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="9" refY="3" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3, 0 6" fill="#f59e0b" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <text x="70" y="140" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Slide</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A line that crosses through two or more other lines.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="30" y1="60" x2="170" y2="60" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="30" y1="120" x2="170" y2="120" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="60" y1="30" x2="140" y2="150" stroke="#ef4444" stroke-width="3" />
  <text x="50" y="180" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">Line crosses two lines</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A four-sided shape with exactly one pair of parallel sides.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="70,60 130,60 160,140 40,140" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="72" y1="65" x2="78" y2="65" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="72" y1="72" x2="78" y2="72" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="42" y1="135" x2="48" y2="135" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <line x1="42" y1="128" x2="48" y2="128" stroke="#f59e0b" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="60" y="110" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">One pair</text>
  <text x="60" y="125" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937">parallel</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A polygon with three sides and three angles.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <polygon points="100,40 40,160 160,160" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.3" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <circle cx="100" cy="40" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="40" cy="160" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />
  <circle cx="160" cy="160" r="4" fill="#ef4444" />

</svg>

terms.definition: A rate where the second quantity is one unit, like 5 miles per 1 hour.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Unit Rate</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A letter or symbol that represents an unknown number or a number that can change.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <text x="70" y="110" font-size="60" fill="#3b82f6" font-weight="bold">x</text>
  <text x="40" y="160" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">Unknown</text>
  <text x="40" y="178" font-size="14" fill="#1f2937">number</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A point where two or more lines, edges, or sides meet, like a corner.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Vertex</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: Opposite angles formed when two lines cross, and they are always equal.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <line x1="30" y1="60" x2="170" y2="140" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <line x1="30" y1="140" x2="170" y2="60" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="3" />
  <path d="M 50 75 A 20 20 0 0 1 60 85" fill="#fbbf24" fill-opacity="0.4" />
  <path d="M 140 115 A 20 20 0 0 1 150 125" fill="#fbbf24" fill-opacity="0.4" />
  <text x="60" y="180" font-size="12" fill="#1f2937" font-weight="bold">Opposite angles equal</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: The amount of space inside a 3D shape, measured in cubic units.
examples: Volume of a 2×3×4 box is 24 cubic units
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">

  <rect x="50" y="90" width="90" height="80" fill="#3b82f6" fill-opacity="0.4" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="50,90 80,60 170,60 140,90" fill="#60a5fa" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <polygon points="140,90 170,60 170,140 140,170" fill="#93c5fd" stroke="#2563eb" stroke-width="2" />
  <text x="45" y="190" font-size="13" fill="#1f2937">Space inside 3D</text>

</svg>

terms.definition: A sample made up of people who chose to participate, which may be biased.
examples: an online poll anyone can answer
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Voluntary</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Response</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Sample</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: A table that shows input values (x) and their corresponding output values (y).
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">X</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Â†’</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Y</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The point where a graph crosses the x-axis, where the y-value is zero.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">X-Intercept</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The slope-intercept form of a line where m is the slope and b is the y-intercept.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="80" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Y</text>
<text x="100" y="105" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">=</text>
<text x="100" y="130" font-size="20" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Mx</text>
<circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>

terms.definition: The point where a graph crosses the y-axis, where the x-value is zero.
terms.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200" width="200" height="200">
<text x="100" y="100" font-size="32" fill="#2563eb" font-weight="bold" text-anchor="middle">Y-Intercept</text><circle cx="100" cy="150" r="3" fill="#10b981" />
</svg>
